topic.title: SYSOTN Abstract

body.p: The SYSOTN Subsystem is identical to the LINEOTN Subsystem, in terms of its architecture and subcomponents. The main difference between SYSOTN and LINEOTN is with its connectivity to the COREOTN subsystem, and its intended use case. LINEOTN interfaces with the COREOTN Stage 1 framers and is intended for HO ODU processing of Line side OTUâ€™s. SYSOTN interfaces with the COREOTN Stage N framers and processes Client/System side ODUs. In addition, unlike LINEOTN which has a dedicated full bandwith connection to COREOTN, SYSOTN bandwidth is shared with the MAPOTN into the COREOTN stage N framers. For more information on how the SYSOTN subsystem is connected to COREOTN, please see the COREOTN block diagram Figure 1 .
